pros: Good coworkers and staff, hours are flexible if you have seniority.
cons: Things can be slow moving at times.

job_title: Community Health Worker in Springfield, MO
pros: The 4 day workweek is convenient. If you’re lucky enough to have the right immediate coworkers, it makes the culture much more bearable.
cons: Pay is atrocious considering they have the funds for raises. The job itself is nothing like it’s described. Meeting with patients can be extremely surface level. Most of the time it’s just documentation and boredom.

pros: I love my coworkers and we what I do.
cons: We are required to do more work for little pay. Working the same amount as 3 people for the pay of 1.
The work load is way too much for the hourly rate.

review_title: Growing company going in the right direction
pros: Jordan Valley has better benefits than other healthcare organizations I have worked for in the area, including the 4-day workweek. I have felt supported in my role here and appreciate what the organization does for the community.
cons: Rapid change means you need to be flexible, I enjoy this aspect but it comes with growing pains.

review_title: Turn and run, you'll thank me later!
cons:
If you need a low paying job for about 2 years, this might be the job for you. If you don't want to add "fired" to your resume, then keep looking. 
They love to hire a big group and then choose favorites, everyone else is slowly weeded out. 
Management is very inconsistent and will micromanage every minute of the work day.

pros: Benefits are nice and four day work weeks
cons: Will move you to any clinic regardless

pros: Great benefits, under $53 a check, paid bi weekly
cons: Not much communication between business office and main clinic, management is actively working on.

review_title: Work schedules were good. Not enough employees
pros: Quite a bit of PTO and holidays paid. Work hours were good.
cons: Too few of employees and expected demand of work is too much. Very stressful job.

pros: Integrated healthcare, family atmosphere, we take care of each other.

job_title: Community Health Worker in Springfield, MO
pros: Great coworkers and I had an amazing lead
cons: Constant change, only 36 hours a week, no room for growth

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Springfield, MO
cons: A lot of cons based on work.

review_title: An amazing place to grow professionally, while doing what you love!
pros: Jordan Valley will work around your school schedule.  They understand the importance of education, and will promote you once you complete your degree.  They also have an amazing medical assisting program. Amber is caring, understanding, and motivating to her students (me and 9 other wonderful people).  Jordan Valley is a family that dedicates themselves to caring for their community's health needs!
cons: The con for me is, that I didn't start here years ago.

review_title: Difficult to provide high quality care
pros: Satisfaction of helping patients that may have nowhere else to go. Plenty of providers, so only on call every 15 nights or so.  Telephone call only, no after hours or hospital work.
cons: Frequent staff turnover.  Poor communication from administration. Expectations greater than can reasonably be expected. Stressful trying to do good patient care with limited resources.

pros: Fun atmosphere, small workplace, friendly co-workers, and a shared vision.
cons: Scheduling in my department seemed like it could be more streamlined.
